text.__SUMMARY__: Shorea crassa is a species of plant in the Dipterocarpaceae family. The species name is derived from Latin (crassus = thick) and refers to thick leaf blade.
text.Description: It is an emergent tree, up to 45 metres (148 ft), found in mixed dipterocarp forest on deep yellow sandy soils. S. crassa is endemic to Borneo. It is found in at least one protected area (Gunung Mulu National Park).
